meanings.definition: A flat, shallow container with a raised edge, used for carrying or holding items.
meanings.sent1: She placed the cookies on the tray.
meanings.sent2: The waiter carried the drinks on a silver tray.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to balance on the tray, thinking it was a bridge.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a tray, holding all the warmth of the sun.
meanings.sent5: The tray gleamed under the kitchen lights, inviting everyone to take a treat.

meanings.definition: A flat, shallow object used for serving food or drinks.
meanings.sent1: He handed her a tray of sandwiches for the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The cafeteria worker stacked the trays neatly for the students.
meanings.sent3: The tray wobbled as she carried it, making the cookies dance.
meanings.sent4: His words were a tray of comfort in her time of need.
meanings.sent5: The tray clattered to the floor, sending drinks flying in all directions.

meanings.definition: To place or carry items on a tray.
meanings.sent1: She would tray the cups carefully to avoid spills.
meanings.sent2: He decided to tray the tools to the shed for safekeeping.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully trayed their toys around the room, pretending to be servers.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter trayed joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The sun trayed its golden light across the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.
